data.title: 2024 Official Selection Fri
data.meta_description: Showcasing the amazing films and screenplays of emerging filmmakers and screenwriters, the Beverly Hills Film Festival is one of the most influential film festivals globally. The BHFF is one of the only authentic platforms that establishes a solid career in the entertainment industry for filmmakers and screenwriters.
data.meta_site_name: Beverly Hills Film Festival | Official Site
data.text:
Haunted

Drama (16 min) United States

Directed By: Jon Amiel

Written By: Jon Amiel, Soraya Garre

Produced By: Soraya Garre, Leanna Tallmeister

Cast: Soraya Garre, Sophia Center, Imani Hanson, Daniel Lee, Tommy Drake

Synopsis: Kate is haunted by the seemingly malevolent spirit of a teenage boy. But is he really malevolent? Is he real? And who are the other people who seem to appear and disappear at random in her artist’s studio? Kate soon finds herself drawn into a frightening labyrinth, where dreams, nightmares, memory and reality violently collide.

Plant Baby

Comedy (7 min) United States

Directed By: Arabella Sharkey

Written By: Arabella Sharkey

Produced By: Patrice Yip

Cast: Sage Guarino, Jenna Maryn Sierra

Synopsis: A struggling drug addict takes care of a plant baby, hoping that by nurturing it, he can learn to take care of himself. However, his addiction beckons him to take one more hit.

Dead Presidents

Comedy (11 min) United States

Directed By: Ryan Lilienfield

Written By: Ryan Lilienfield

Produced By: Gabrielle Chapman

Cast: Galen Howard, Blake Sheldon, Corey Landis, Pierce Lackey

Synopsis: Two brothers, one robbery, no plan. After their pops gets blasted on a stick-up job, stoner brothers Mark and Chris pack the blunts and strap up to rob a local bank. Bad comes to worse as the robbery devolves into a hostage situation through a series of mistakes. With a slip of the finger, their dreams of beers, boobs, and bud in Amsterdam go up in smoke.

I’m Todor. I Mean, Bill.

Comedy (17 min) United States

Directed By: Madison Leonard

Written By: Madison Leonard

Produced By: Rachael Dahl, Elizabete Sadauska, Madison Leonard

Cast: Arye Gross, Christie Griffin, Laura Candela

Synopsis: A quirky romantic comedy about a grief stricken widower in the throes of a mid-life crisis searches for intimacy in the most unorthodox of ways when he makes an unexpected connection with a spirited young woman in his neighborhood.

To the Moon and Back

Comedy (18 min) United States

Directed By: Charlie Posey

Written By: Charlie Posey, Emily Liberatore

Produced By: Nikki Spina

Cast: Emily Abeles, Katherine Martin, James Bobo, Ted Wells

Synopsis: When, Rhea, a wide-eyed young girl, asks the moon to send her a friend, she comes face-to-face with the older version of herself, now depressed and in a dead-end job, and must learn to love who she is.

Funnel Mantra

Drama (11 min) Mexico

Directed By: Andres Gonzalez

Written By: Andres Gonzalez

Produced By: Miguel Gonzalez, Karen Kotto, Andres Gonzalez

Cast: Yatzini Aparicio, Roberto Oropeza.

Synopsis: Through a psychoanalytic session, an artist recapitulates a stage of her life looking for a personal temporal metric to be able to judge free will and personal patterns.

Red Lake

Horror (14 min) Ireland

Directed By: Shaun Dunne

Written By: Claire Bermingham, Dani Alvarado

Produced By: Claire Bermingham, Aoife O’Neill, Max Brady, Pull the Trigger Productions

Cast: Claire Bermingham, Hazel Doupe, Terry O’Neill

Synopsis:Mourning the death of their father, two half sisters discover that some legends are real and that resentment can indeed can breed a monster.

Dream

Drama (15 min) Russian Federation

Directed By: Artur Matveev

Written By: Artur Matveev

Produced By: Andrey Lisyanskiy, Stanislav Khatyukhin

Cast: Aleksandra Kulikova, Anton Vlasov, Andrey Trushin, Anastasia Baktimirova, Alexey Soshin

Synopsis: In pursuit of his dreams, Igor faces the devastating loss of his loved one, a truth he struggles to accept. Supported by his pragmatic friend Mr. Raef, Igor wrestles with the temptation to take drastic action in his grief, realizing the profound consequences it could have on his path and identity. It’s a poignant exploration of love, loss, and moral dilemmas.

Annie’s Movie

Drama (16 min) Finland

Directed By: Nuutti Aleksis

Written By: Nuutti Aleksis

Produced By: Nuutti Aleksis, Kalliope Poulianos

Cast: Christi Glass, John Robilette, Marie Elizabeth, Serena Gordon

Synopsis: Annie from New Jersey is driving across the United States. When her credit card stops working and she runs out of gas, she stops at a desolate motel. Despite clues that Annie might be running away from something, the lonely motel owner wants to help her. That might not turn out well for him.

Born From Dust: The Art of Richard Wilks

Documentary (5 min) United States

Directed By: Simone Staff, Nick Paskhover

Written By: Simone Staff, Nick Paskhover

Produced By: Simone Staff, Nick Paskhover

Cast: Richard Wilks

Synopsis: In this captivating and visually stunning documentary, we embark on an inspiring journey alongside Richard Wilks –a multimedia sculptor– as he undergoes a remarkable transformation. Beginning as a 2D graphic designer, he dares to venture into uncharted territory, where his artistic evolution takes the form of colossal 3D sculptures meticulously crafted from repurposed materials.

California Locos Renaissance and Rebellion

Documentary (9 min) United States

Directed By: Dave Tourje

Written By: Adam Cude

Produced By: Dave Tourje, Alana Reinhart, Michelle Irwin, Ariana Flanagan

Cast: Chaz Bojorquez, Dave Tourje, John Van Hamersveld, Norton Wisdom, Gary Wong

Synopsis: The members of the acclaimed art collective California Locos give their views on what makes post-modern Los Angeles tick. Chaz Bojorquez, Dave Tourje, John Van Hamersveld, Norton Wisdom and Gary Wong all share their asymmetrical insights emanating from their diverse approaches in art and culture, having been born and raised in the mega-metropolis. Music by Los Savages with Ian Espinoza, Dave Tourjé, Jim Grinta, Toby Holmes and Bryan Head.

How It Breathes

Documentary (9 min) United States

Directed By: Jack Gordon

Written By: Jack Gordon

Produced By: Jack Gordon

Cast: Elijah Jamal Balbed

Synopsis: As the District of Columbia changed around Elijah Jamal Babled, his budding career as a musician exposed him to the people and music providing a voice and an outlet to the people of DC. Now tasked with preserving and sharing that tradition, Balbed reflects on balancing that responsibility with creating a musical identity of his own.

The Chicago Lago

Documentary (10 min) United States

Directed By: Valerie Zabriskie

Written By:

Produced By: Valerie Zabriskie

Cast: Ivan Vazquez, DJ Shon Dervis, Drummer Ernie Adams, Furious Styles, Logan Lu

Synopsis: The Chicago Lago is a heartfelt story of a contemporary Mexican American/indigenous visual artist and designer born and based in Chicago, Illinois. The representation of music, Chicago, and hip-hop culture in his work reflects what saved his life and the need to give all that love back to the community.

The Collector

Documentary (15 min) United States

Directed By: Carrie Wachob, Jim Picariello

Written By: Carrie Wachob

Produced By: Carrie Wachob, Marghee Baldridge

Cast: Willard Carroll

Synopsis: After watching The Wizard of Oz when he was five years old, Willard Carroll started a journey down his own yellow brick road to become a pop culture fanatic and award-winning filmmaker. Owner of the world’s largest private collection of Oz memorabilia, Willard is living proof that one story can change the entire trajectory of your life.

Incandescence

Documentary (20 min) United States

Directed By: Reisha Perlmutter

Written By: Reisha Perlmutter

Produced By: Reisha Perlmutter, DK Johnston

Cast: Ruby Vizcarra, Reisha, Perlmutter

Synopsis: A NYC classically trained painter finds new meaning in realism. She connects with a woman on a journey to find self acceptance through her albinism in the Yucatan’s cenotes. Together, they find something real beyond the constructs of the outside world.

All-American Terrorist

Drama (14 min) United States

Directed By: Payton Bayless

Written By: Payton Bayless

Produced By: Payton Bayless, Blake Bennett, Emily Hileman

Cast: Nick Basile, Ryan Francis, Ben Stillwell White, Logan Collins

Synopsis: After the subtle death of his little sister. Moses sets out for help, In an attempt to restore the balance of his life and protect his family. However, he lands himself in greater danger when he seeks out help from the wrong side of the barrel.

Just Now Jeffrey

Comedy (117 min) South Africa

Directed By: Brett Morris, Hylton Tannenbaum

Written By: Brett Morris, Hylton Tannenbaum

Produced By: Shireen Hattingh, Daniel Kaplan, Brett Morris, Hylton Tannenbaum

Cast: Julian Robinson, Dino Vavatzanidis, Rob van Vuuren, Nik Rabinowitz, Nicky Rebelo, Natasha Loring, Mila Rayne.

Synopsis: While the world was radically changing around him, teenager Jeffrey Greenbaum hardly noticed. He just needed to get laid. Jeffrey convinces his best pal Brad Berman, to help devise a strategy to lose their virginity before they finish high school. But things don’t go as planned and Jeffrey and Brad soon become entangled in a crazy web of love, lust, videotape piracy, rugby violence, political protest, antisemitism and Afrikaans pornography.

Things Worse

Drama (13 min) United States

Directed By: O.G. Ellison

Written By: O.G. Ellison

Produced By: O.G. Ellison, Aida Rodriguez, Roberto Jose Melgar

Cast: Roberto Jose Melgar, Alondra Andrade, Richard Lee Warren, Deyshaun Tucker

Synopsis: A corrupt detective loses his grip on reality in the final weeks of his contract. When the department maintains their usual racket, he struggles within to maintain his sanity while visions of his past haunt him.

Caller 102: A Ballad of Cyberspace

Thriller (17 min) United States

Directed By: Turner Barrowman, Jack Goldfisher

Written By: Turner Barrowman, Jack Goldfisher

Produced By: Turner Barrowman, Jack Goldfisher, Brandon Scott Wolf, Jacqueline Medina, Elliott Thornton

Cast: Josh Brener, Arryn Zech, Sean Carrigan, Brianna Baker, Dan Cole, Gabriella Weltman

Synopsis: When a blackhat hacker working on a highly secretive project gets hit with a coincidentally-timed power surge, he begins to unravel a web of conspiracy that threatens to bring down his life’s work and send him spiraling into oblivion.

The Inevitable Process of Drowning

Drama (18 min) United States

Directed By: Marco Bazzi

Written By: Marco Bazzi

Produced By: Marco Bazzi

Cast: Havon Baraka, Liam Hawley

Synopsis: In a dystopian reality, Ryan’s perception blurs between reality and dreams. After receiving a mysterious card, he complies and finds himself facing a procedure that demands the sacrifice of his best friend. Ryan questions the system, suspecting manipulation through substances in food and water that suppress dreaming and enforce compliance to a sinister agenda disguised as freedom.

Viscera

Fantasy (20 min) United States

Directed By: David Venghaus Jr.

Written By: Zach Canon

Produced By: Nick Moon, Zach Canon, Rena D Cruz Art, Hannah Canon, Canaan Sanders, Karen-Ann Clancy, Sean O. Mcguinnes

Cast: Zach Canon, Molly B. Thomas, Carrie Lloyd, Hannah Canon, Canaan Sanders

Synopsis: Stuck in a cycle from infidelity, Coline and Young seek out an experimental therapist for solutions. When the Therapists’ method border on inhumane, they must find common ground to avoid permanent damage.

Demolition

Thriller (21 min) United States

Directed By: Megan Raney Aarons

Written By: Megan Raney Aarons

Produced By: Colin K Gray, Megan Raney Aarons, Chiara Fornetti, Eden Perry, Allison Cox

Cast: Sloan: Lacey Claire Rogers, Therapist: Stephen Park, Podcaster: Fanny Veliz Grande, Gal Pal: Eden Perry, Latin Lover: Alessandro Marino, Unhoused: Amara Agomuo, Teen: Kaitlyn Kemp, Girl In Hall: Helen Day

Synopsis: A twisted look at influencer culture, social media & AI, Demolition is a playful psychological thriller about a lonely bikini model questioning her own authenticity in the face of a wild crisis of consciousness.

Snip, Snip

Comedy (5 min) United States

Directed By: The Edelmans

Written By: The Edelmans

Produced By: Molly Edelman, Walker Edelman

Cast: Molly Edelman, Walker Edelman, Annika Foster, Cole Cuomo

Synopsis: While hosting a party, Rose and Cameron are forced to look parenthood in the face. Their newly pregnant friends corner them and can’t stop bragging about the gift of their journey. Overwhelmed and annoyed the couple lock themselves in their bedroom to fight about babies, vasectomies, and…the future.

Black Friday

Comedy (6 min) United States

Directed By: Jenna Milly

Written By: Jenna Milly, Ann Marie Allison

Produced By: Jenna Milly, Andrew DeCesare, Mike Day

Cast: Abbey McBride, Bayne Gibby, Thomas Forbes-Johnson, Quincy Cho, Vanessa Zamarripa, Hardy Awadjie, Lianna Holston, Max Maddox, Ianula Darlaiane, Jaclyn Neuffer, Umit Tayanc, Mike Day

Synopsis: A female comedy set in the world of Black Friday. When one woman sets out to buy a doll for her daughter, she discovers it’s not that easy to win at the game of being a mom.

Gut Punch

Comedy (13 min) United States

Directed By: Jon Ryan Sugimoto

Written By: Jon Ryan Sugimoto

Produced By: Jon Ryan Sugimoto and Brenna Webb

Cast: Joe List, Radel Ortiz, Greer Barned, Sabrina Piper, Adam Alpert, Luis Rosa, Justin Whang

Synopsis: When a customer Dan (Joe List) coughs a little too much, Manny (Radel Ortiz), the owner wants to boot Dan out of the bodega. Dan resists, and soon he, Manny and Rex get into an argument over probiotics, prebiotics and antibiotics, each side making passionate but ill-informed points and spinning the discussion into increasingly absurd directions.

Another Happy Day

Comedy (90 min) United States

Directed By: Nora Fiffer

Written By: Nora Fiffer

Produced By: Jessie Holder Tourtellotte

Cast: Lauren Lapkus, Marilyn Dodds Frank, Jean Elie, Carrie Coon

Synopsis: Desperate for some company, a delirious new mother tumbles into a magnetic friendship with her estranged aunt – an eccentric recluse with even more demands than her baby.

I’m Glad That You’re Sorry

Comedy (9 min) United States

Directed By: Jourdan Henderson

Written By: Jourdan Henderson, Carla Miller

Produced By: Jourdan Henderson, Michael Day

Cast: Emily Pendergast, Lisa Schurga, Allison Dunbar, Chad Jamian, Mitch Silpa, Michael Churven, Melanie Johnson, Andrew Friedman

Synopsis: When Gina brings her boyfriend, Brian, to her dysfunctional family’s Thanksgiving dinner, tensions rise, secrets spill, and an unexpected confrontation leaves Brian shell-shocked and desperate for an escape.

L’Agence & Choose Love present “Pool Party”

Comedy (9 min) United States

Directed By: Brandon Bernath

Written By: Brandon Bernath

Produced By: Brandon Bernath, Elizabeth Mihelich

Cast: Daigo Yamashita, Rachelle Carson Begley

Synopsis: Beverly Holloway, an aged Brentwood heiress and Danny Dynamite, her young Japanese rockabilly boyfriend, break up… again. But this time, it’s serious. Beverly decides to throw a pool party and invite all of her friends. Will Beverly and Danny get back together, or is it finally over?

Wake

Drama (12 min) United States

Directed By: Sean Carter

Written By: Sean Carter

Produced By: Lauren Fash

Cast: K Steele; Milly Sanders; Lavelle Roby; Catherine McCafferty

Synopsis: With a hurricane raging outside their hospital, two nurses have one last job before evacuating: stow the “dead-on- arrival” corpse of a young girl in the downstairs morgue before the building floods. But the corpse quickly reveals itself to be more than it seems.

Larry in the Sky with Diamonds

Comedy (24 min) United States

Directed By: David Sonnenborn

Written By: Peter S. Kim, David Sonnenborn

Produced By: Lauren C. Brooks, Clement Chan, Wei Chen, Brent Hagata, Peter S. Kim, Jeremy Klavens, Aaron Klemanski, Rex Lee, Katy Palfrey, David Sonnenborn

Cast: Peter S. Kim, Rex Lee, Sterling Jones, Franqi French, Harry Hart-Browne, May Lee, Andre Hotchko, William Shin, Elaine Rivkin, Esther Moon, Scot Shamblin, Elim Uraimov

Synopsis: Matt, a suddenly divorced and unemployed gay man, overdoses on psychedelics and reconnects with his Uncle Larry who died of AIDS in the ‘90s. Be he a ghost, a guardian angel, or a drug-induced hallucination, Larry is the one person, alive or dead, who can get Matt’s life back on track.

Drawn

Horror (25 min) United States

Directed By: Ty Clancey

Written By: Ty Clancey

Produced By: Bo Clancey, Ty Clancey

Cast: Jesse Garcia, Clayne Crawford, Diana Zermeño

Synopsis: A widower and his young daughter fend off a predatory land speculator by any means necessary in this psychological thriller set on a dying ranch in the Southwest. With shifting points of view and a twisting power structure, the story delves deep into our perception of control, unraveling a family mystery that spawns eerie tension, abducts our expectations of good and evil, and draws us in to a shocking reveal.

Camera

Drama (112 min) United States

Directed By: Jay Silverman

Written By: Jamie Murphy, Joe Gamache

Produced By: Jay Silverman, Bethany Cerrona, Ian Christian Blanche, Beau Bridges, Joe Gamache

Cast: Beau Bridges, Jessica Parker Kennedy, Miguel Gabriel, Bruce Davison, Scotty Tovar, Jorge-Luis Pallo, Ross Partridge

Synopsis: Camera is the heartwarming story of loss, hope, and healing that follows Oscar, a 9-year-old boy who cannot speak but has a gift to see great beauty where others only see despair. When a broken film camera brings him together with Eric, an eccentric repairman, an unlikely friendship develops. Under Eric’s mentorship, Oscar finds his voice through photography and in doing so heals a wounded community.

The Invisibles

Drama (107 min) Canada

Directed By: Andrew Currie

Written By: Andrew Currie & Colin Aussant

Produced By: Mary Anne Waterhouse, Lee Kim

Cast: Tim Blake Nelson, Bruce Greenwood, Nathan Alexis, Gretchen Mol

Synopsis: In the midst of a crumbling marriage and a stalled career, Charlie feels increasingly invisible—until he literally starts to disappear. The Invisibles takes us on a visually arresting journey to a parallel dimension where the disappeared co-exist, unnoticed by the real world. As Charlie tries to return to his wife, he’s forced to confront the real reason he disappeared in the first place.

Love and Taxe$

Romance (102 min) United States

Directed By: Ken Feinberg, Craig D. Tollis

Written By: Lloyd J. Schwartz

Produced By: Ken Feinberg, Lloyd.J. Schwartz, Juan Feldman, Ryan Bifulco

Cast: Jake Reiner, Alexis Abrams

Synopsis: In this unique 70s romance crafted by Lloyd J. Schwartz, renowned “Brady Bunch” writer and producer, an unconventional story unfolds between a CPA and a waitress. Their connection, an annual meeting under the guise of preparing her taxes. Yet, with each passing year, these sessions evolve into much more than number crunching.

Silent Thunder

Horror (107 min) United States

Directed By: Isaac Medeiros

Written By: Isaac Medeiros

Produced By: Jack Lucarelli, Michael Lazari, Gigi Rice, Ted McGinley, Rich Turner

Cast: Ted McGinley, Jonathan Stoddard, Jack Lucarelli, Laura James Ecker, Cassi Colvin, Brent Kublick, Rich Turner

Synopsis: With the help of two bank robbers, a U.S Marshal sets out to rescue five prostitutes who have been abducted by a gang of desert dwelling, otherworldly, monsters.
